  • Method Details

    • getZombies

      public List<Zombie> getZombies()
      returns a list of all zombies in the game.

      list of all zombies in the game.

    • getSurvivors

      returns a list of all survivors in the game.
      Returns:
      list of all survivors in the game.

    • getFixedObjects

      public List<GameElement> getFixedObjects()
      returns a list of all fixed objects in the game.
      Returns:
      list of all fixed objects in the game.

    • getObstacles

      public List<Obstacle> getObstacles()
      returns a list of all obstacles in the game.
      Returns:
      list of all obstacles in the game.

    • isHasWon

      public boolean isHasWon()
      method to check if the game is won or still running.
      Returns:
      true, if the game is won.

    • isHasLost

      public boolean isHasLost()
      method to check if the game is lost or still running.
      Returns:
      true, if the game is lost.

    • adjustGame

      public void adjustGame()
      method asks the user for the difficulty input when called.

    • adjustGame

      public void adjustGame(int difficulty)
      method sets the difficulty setting to the received argument.
      Parameters:
      difficulty - 1 = easy, 2 = medium, 3 = hard

    • setupGame

      public void setupGame()
      method creates a winnable game-board.

    • isWinnableGame

      private boolean isWinnableGame()
      method compares the amount of turns the player and zombie needs to reach the exit. method doesn't check possible use of items and remedy spawns.
      Returns:
      true, if the game is winnable for the user

    • areZombiesAlive

      private boolean areZombiesAlive()
      checks if at least one zombie is live.
      Returns:
      true if at least one zombie is alive.

    • nextRound

      public void nextRound() throws Exception
      increases the score for every new round.
      checks the locations for every gameElement and will do something (explained in the methods) if positions are equal.
      checks if the game has been won or lost.
      Throws:
      Exception - (if an error happened)

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      startGame() displays the board with its GameElements.
      Also takes input for moving the characters etc.
